intro: Aethionema erzincanum, commonly known as Erzincan rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, yellow flowers in the spring. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. Aethionema erzincanum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
